page.title: 18FARMING IN CAREW AREA,TENBY.
page.content: { Most in the Carew area are betwwen {100_250 acres. The majority of farms {are mixed;dairy}farming was important but many farmers are now concentrating on{beef.}Farms also grow{corn}and {potatoes. { Many of the farms are old.}Some farm buildings are more than 200 years old. {Honey Park Farm is dated 1687. There have been a few changes in farming.{Because of Common Market {regulations people have cut back on {the dairy side}and have tried beef, potatoes and corn.Just after the war of 1939_1945 sugar beet and flax were grown in places. { Some of the produce is sold locally_ {eggs and potatoes.Milk goes to the {Creamery at Whitland.} Some farmers have turned to tourism, providing fields for caravans.
